programme.title: Waging War on Viruses
programme.short_synopsis: In the battle to stop viral attacks on people and livestock, why isn't humankind winning?
programme.medium_synopsis: In the battle to stop viral attacks on people, plants and livestock, why isn't humankind winning?
programme.long_synopsis:
Life on this planet is under constant attack.  

Our own bodies, the food crops we rely on and the livestock on which we depend for meat and milk, they are all susceptible to devastating infection by viruses. 

Waging War on Viruses meets the people at the forefront of viral research to reveal the progress in the fight carried by the science community against the pathogens that plague us. 

It examines the minutiae of viruses to reveal, in simple terms, the characteristics that make them such effective survivors and killers.

If we can't dodge attack from viruses then why have we relatively few weapons against viruses, compared to what we have against bacteria? 

On the frontline, in fields, hospitals and laboratories, the specialists explain current and future controls.  

Discovery examines the lessons learned in the wake of the swine flu pandemic, as well as the impact of the exciting eradication this year of the worldâ€™s most serious animal virus. 

What will these all mean for potential control of other diseases?
